data.title: Ancestry of Harold Wilson
data.text:
Click here for other prime ministers.

THE ANCESTRY OF HAROLD WILSON

1 James Harold Wilson, Baron Wilson of Rievaulx

b 11 Mar 1916, Linthwaite, Yorkshire

d 23/24 May 1995, Lambeth, London

Parents

2 James Herbert Wilson of Openshaw, Lancashire, chemist

b 12 Dec 1882, Chorlton-upon-Medlock, Lancashire

d 8 Nov 1971, Perth, Western Australia

m 14 Mar 1906, Congregational Church, Openshaw

3 Ethel Seddon, school teacher

b 10 Apr 1882, Openshaw

d 21 Dec 1958, Biscovey, Cornwall

Grandparents

4 James Wilson of Sale, draper

b 18 Nov 1843, Rievaulx, Yorkshire

d

m 6 Apr 1872, Oakes Baptist Chapel, Lindley, Yorkshire

5 Eliza Jane Thewlis

b 7 Apr 1847, Huddersfield

d 20 Apr 1925, Heaton Chapel

6 William Seddon of Openshaw, Lancashire, and of Nedlands, Western Australia, clerk

b 4 Jun 1855, Whitefield, Lancashire

d Jan 1934, Bullsbrook, Western Australia

m 28 Apr 1880, Independent Chapel, Chorlton-upon-Medlock

7 Elizabeth Ann Davy

b 9 Jan 1856, Doncaster, Yorkshire

d 24 Jun 1938, Nedlands

Great-grandparents

8 John Wilson of York, shoemaker, farmer, and workhouse master

bap 7 Nov 1817, Helmsley

d 28 Oct 1882, York

m 7 Aug 1841, Helmsley

9 Esther Cole

bap 8 Feb 1818, Old Byland, Yorkshire

d 30 Apr 1895, York

10 Titus Thewlis of Huddersfield, cotton warp manufacturer

b Golcar, bap 29 Nov 1813, Golcar

d 13 Jun 1866, Huddersfield

m 21 Jul 1838, Collegiate Church, Manchester

11 Mary Ann Eastwood

b 12 Feb 1815, Almondbury, Yorkshire

d 12 Dec 1865

12 Thomas Seddon of Openshaw, coalman

b 21 Mar 1825, Whitefield

d 10 Dec 1916, Styal

m 25 Sep 1854, Stand, Lancashire

13 Mary Taylor

b 1 Aug 1828, Pilkington

d ca 1896

14 David Davy of Openshaw, railway mechanic

b ca 1830, Bradford, Yorkshire

d 8 Apr 1900

m 3 Apr 1853, Bradford

15 Jane Whitfield

bap 20 Sep 1829, Wetherby, Yorkshire

d 11 Mar 1891, Openshaw

Great-great-grandparents

16 James Wilson of Helmsley, Yorkshire, cordwainer and farmer

bap 2 May 1790, Edston

bur 2 Sep 1825, Helmsley

m 16 Nov 1816, Helmsley

17 Elizabeth Hawkins

b ca 1781, Rievaulx

bur 30 Dec 1859, Helmsley

18 Thomas Cole of Old Byland, farmer

b ca 1793, Old Byland

bur 2 Feb 1871, Old Byland

m 9 Jan 1817, Hawnby, Yorkshire

19 Sarah Bentley

b 22 Nov 1792, Snilesworth

bur 2 Mar 1857, Old Byland

20 Thomas Thewlis of Crimble, weaver

b ca 1785, Golcar

bur 4 Apr 1862, Golcar

m 27 Apr 1807, St Peter, Huddersfield

21 Phoebe Wood

bap 11 Mar 1786, Slaithwaite

bur 5 Oct 1845, Golcar

22 James Eastwood, spinner

b

d

m

23 Betty

b

d

24 Simeon Seddon of Whitefield, weaver

b ca 1792

bur 16 Jan 1839, Stand

m 24 Mar 1818, Prestwich

25 Mary Holt

b ca 1791, Whitefield

bur 1 Mar 1857, Stand

26 Richard Taylor of Prestwich, manufacturer

b ca 1793

d 28 Oct 1833

m 4 Jul 1827, Prestwich

27 Betty Howarth

b ca 1808, Pilkington

d 15 Jul 1863

28 David Davy of Braithwaite and Horton, farmer

b ca 1785

bur 7 Sep 1850, Bradford

m 5 Jul 1813, Keighley

29 Elizabeth Sharp

b ca 1788

d 3 Oct 1838, Bradford

30 James Whitfield of Wetherby and Ripon, ostler

b 11 May 1801, Wetherby

bur 9 Dec 1855, Ripon

m 18 Jul 1821, Spofforth

31 Susannah Hall

b ca 1797

bur 31 Jan 1831, Spofforth

Sources

C.R. Humphery-Smith and M.G. Heenan, The Ancestry of Mr Harold Wilson, Family History, vol. 3 no. 17/18 (Nov 1965), vol. 4 no. 19 (Jan 1966)

The Pedigree of a Prime Minister and Narrative Pedigree of Harold Wilson, Blackmansbury, vol. 2 no. 3 (Aug 1965), 71-82

Oxford Dictionary of National Biography
